org.rocketproplab.marginalstability.flightcomputer.hal

Class MAX14830

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rocketproplab.marginalstability.flightcomputer.hal.MAX14830
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PollingSensor

    public class MAX14830
extends java.lang.Object
implements PollingSensor
    A class that implements the SPI protocol for the MAX14830, it contains the code to emit serial port events to any listeners listening to ports provided by the MAX14830.
    Author:
    Max Apodaca

    • Method Detail

      • getTXBufferLen

        protected int getTXBufferLen(MAX14830.Port port)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Read the length of the transmit buffer for a given port. This will return how many bytes can currently be written.
        Parameters:
        port - which of the four uart channels to read from
        Returns:
        the number of free bytes in the FIFO buffer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if we are unable to access /dev/spix.x via Pi4J

      • getRXBufferLen

        protected int getRXBufferLen(MAX14830.Port port)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Read the receive buffer length for a given port. This reports the number of bytes in the receive buffer that can be currently read.
        Parameters:
        port - which of the four uart channels to read for.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes that can be read from the given FIFO buffer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if we are unable to access /dev/spix.x via Pi4J

      • readRegister

        private int readRegister(byte command)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Read the given register from the chip by executing the given command. Command are the command bits as outlined in the datasheet https://datasheets.maximintegrated.com/en/ds/MAX14830.pdf.

        The command looks like this on a bit level:
        | RW | U1 | U0 | A4 | A3 | A2 | A1 | A0 |
        • RW should be 0 to indicate reading.
        • U1 and U0 from a 2 bit integer to specify UART 0 - 3.
        • A4 - A0 form a 5 bit integer to specify which register to read. Registers above 0x1F (31) are currently not supported as they are read in a different way.
        Parameters:
        command - the command to write
        Returns:
        -1 on failure or the value of the register
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if we are unable to access /dev/spix.x via Pi4J

      • writeToTxFifo

        protected int writeToTxFifo(MAX14830.Port port,
                            int charCount)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Trigger a write to the given UART tx FIFO buffer. The data for the write comes from the internal buffer uartBufferArray.
        This method does not check the buffer fill level getTXBufferLen(Port) and therefore it is possible to loose data if too many bytes are sent.. If there are too few bytes in the uartBufferArray then the remaining bytes are written.
        Parameters:
        port - Which UART channel to use
        charCount - how many bytes to write at most
        Returns:
        how many bytes were actually written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if we are unable to access /dev/spix.x via Pi4J

      • readFromRxFifo

        protected byte[] readFromRxFifo(MAX14830.Port port,
                                int charCount)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Try to read from the RX FIFO buffer for the specified UART channel. This method does not check if the buffer actually has enough data.
        Parameters:
        port - which channel to read from
        charCount - how many characters to read
        Returns:
        the characters as a byte stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if we are unable to access /dev/spix.x via Pi4J

      • getPort

        public SerialPort getPort(MAX14830.Port port)
        Get a serial port interface compatible representation of the given port. This can be used as any other serial port would be.
        Parameters:
        port - which UART interface to use
        Returns:
        the serial port created for the UART interface.

      • writeToPort

        public void writeToPort(MAX14830.Port port,
                        java.lang.String data)
        Queue the string to be written to the specified port as soon as possible.
        Parameters:
        port - which UART interface to write to
        data - the string to write. Will wait until previous stirngs have been written.

      • selectBuffer

        private java.lang.StringBuffer selectBuffer(MAX14830.Port port)
        Get the string buffer acting as a queue for the given port.
        Parameters:
        port - which UART buffer to select.
        Returns:
        the string buffer acting as a queue

      • writeToPort

        private void writeToPort(MAX14830.Port port,
                         int length)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Check if there is enough space left in the TX FIFO for the given port and if so write the queued strings to it. If not write as much as we can.

        The length is cached to prevent unnecessary calls to getTXBufferLen(Port). If we see that there is enough space from the last call to getTXBufferLen(Port) we write to it.
        Parameters:
        port - Which port to select
        length - How many characters to write, must be >= 0
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if we are unable to access /dev/spix.x via Pi4J

      • readFromPort

        private void readFromPort(MAX14830.Port port,
                          int length)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Read from the given port and call the SerilPort callbacks. Length must be smaller or equal to the number of bytes in the RX FIFO.
        Parameters:
        port - which port to read
        length - how many bytes to read, passed directly to readFromRxFifo(Port, int)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if we are unable to access /dev/spix.x via Pi4J

      • pollPort

        private void pollPort(MAX14830.Port port)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Check if we should send more data to the TX buffer of the port. If so send the data.
        Then check if we have data to receive in the RX buffer. If so receive it and emit events.
        Parameters:
        port - which UART port to read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if we are unable to access /dev/spix.x via Pi4J

      • poll

        public void poll()
        Description copied from interface: PollingSensor
        Polls the sensor
        Specified by:
        poll in interface PollingSensor

      • setBaudRate

        public void setBaudRate(MAX14830.Port port,
                        int baudrate)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Set the baud rate for the UART channel as best as possible. The baud rate is calculated with the equation BaudRate = fREF / (16 * D) where D is an integer and fREF is the crystal frequency. To select D we use the equation fREF / ( 16 * BaudRate ) which is located on page 21 of the datasheet. The fREF used is Settings.MAX14830_F_REF. All math is integer math so fREF must be an integer multiple of 16 * BaudRate or the actual baud rate will differ from the requested.
        Parameters:
        port - the UART channel to use
        baudrate - the baud rate in baud
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if we are unable to access /dev/spix.x via Pi4J
